snippet: Twentieth Century Fox is changing its marketing strategy for the film “Neighborhood Watch” in the wake of the killing of a teenager by a community watch participant.
abstract: Twentieth Century Fox is changing its marketing strategy for the film Neighborhood Watch in the wake of the killing of Trayvon Martin by community watch participant, George Zimmerman, in Sanford, Fla; in a phased withdrawal that began late last month Fox pre-emptively withdrew its trailers and advertising materials for the movie, which was filmed in Georgia and is about four suburban watch members who save their neighborhood, and the world, from an invasion by space aliens.
lead_paragraph: Twentieth Century Fox is changing its marketing strategy for the film “Neighborhood Watch” in the wake of the killing of a teenager by a community watch participant.

headline.seo: Bad Timing for a Comedy Called ‘Neighborhood Watch’
headline.main: Comedy Timing Is Bad as News and Film Collide
headline.print_headline: Comedy Timing Is Bad as News And Film Collide
